articles.headline: A Timeline of Trump’s False and Misleading Statements on the Mar-a-Lago Search
articles.snippet: The former president has pushed frenetic and sometimes contradictory claims about the F.B.I.’s search of his Florida home.
articles.abstract: The former president has pushed frenetic and sometimes contradictory claims about the F.B.I.’s search of his Florida home.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the days since former President Donald J. Trump’s Florida home was searched by federal agents last week, he has posted dozens of messages on Truth Social, his social media platform, about the Democrats, the F.B.I. and other perceived foes.

articles.headline: Biden Signs Climate, Health Bill Into Law as Other Economic Goals Remain
articles.snippet: The bill is the latest victory for the president on overhauling the physical economy, but he has found less support for plans to help workers.
articles.abstract: The bill is the latest victory for the president on overhauling the physical economy, but he has found less support for plans to help workers.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Biden signed into law a landmark tax, health and energy bill on Tuesday that takes significant steps toward fulfilling his goal to modernize the American economy and reduce its dependence on fossil fuels.

articles.headline: Ukraine Strikes Again in Crimea, Posing a New Challenge for Putin
articles.snippet: President Vladimir V. Putin has made Russia’s seizure of the peninsula a centerpiece of his 22-year rule, but a series of clandestine attacks by Ukrainian forces recently have tested security there.
articles.abstract: President Vladimir V. Putin has made Russia’s seizure of the peninsula a centerpiece of his 22-year rule, but a series of clandestine attacks by Ukrainian forces recently have tested security there.
articles.lead_paragraph: ODESA, Ukraine — Russian warships patrol Crimea’s coasts and Russian warplanes fly from its territory, transformed by eight years of occupation into a fortress. President Vladimir V. Putin has called Crimea a “sacred place,” Russia’s “holy land,” and one of his top advisers has warned that if the peninsula were attacked, Ukraine would face “Judgment Day.”
articles.byline: By Michael Schwirtz and Anton Troianovski

articles.headline: Liz Cheney Is Defeated by Trump-Backed Harriet Hageman in Wyoming
articles.snippet: Ms. Hageman’s easy victory was a blunt repudiation of Ms. Cheney and her relentless campaign to stop Donald J. Trump. Ms. Cheney vowed to not let up.
articles.abstract: Ms. Hageman’s easy victory was a blunt repudiation of Ms. Cheney and her relentless campaign to stop Donald J. Trump. Ms. Cheney vowed to not let up.
articles.lead_paragraph: JACKSON, Wyo. — Representative Liz Cheney of Wyoming was resoundingly defeated by Harriet Hageman in her Republican primary on Tuesday, handing Donald J. Trump his most prized trophy yet in his long campaign to purge the Republican Party of his critics.

articles.headline: Behind Enemy Lines, Ukrainians Tell Russians ‘You Are Never Safe’
articles.snippet: Clandestine resistance cells are spotting targets, sabotaging rail lines and killing those deemed collaborators as they seek to unnerve Russian forces.
articles.abstract: Clandestine resistance cells are spotting targets, sabotaging rail lines and killing those deemed collaborators as they seek to unnerve Russian forces.
articles.lead_paragraph: ZAPORIZHZHIA, Ukraine — They sneak down darkened alleys to set explosives. They identify Russian targets for Ukrainian artillery and long-range rockets provided by the United States. They blow up rail lines and assassinate officials they consider collaborators with the Russians.

articles.headline: Inflation in Britain Jumps to 10.1 Percent, Pushed Higher by Food Prices
articles.snippet: The surge in prices is expected to peak in the autumn, when household energy bills are likely to sharply increase.
articles.abstract: The surge in prices is expected to peak in the autumn, when household energy bills are likely to sharply increase.
articles.lead_paragraph: Consumer prices in Britain continued to jump higher in July, rising 10.1 percent from a year earlier. It was the fastest pace since 1982 and has intensified the pressure on household budgets being squeezed by surging energy and food costs.

articles.headline: Tech Hacks to Make Traveling Right Now Less of a Headache
articles.snippet: The travel industry is recovering from the pandemic, but messily. These apps and tips can help us navigate the chaos and maximize our comfort.
articles.abstract: The travel industry is recovering from the pandemic, but messily. These apps and tips can help us navigate the chaos and maximize our comfort.
articles.lead_paragraph: Anyone who has gone on a trip in the last year probably has a horror story. Canceled flights have abounded. Customer service wait times with airlines can be hours long. In some places, the costs of rental cars and plane tickets have become astronomical.

articles.headline: As China’s Economy Stumbles, Homeowners Boycott Mortgage Payments
articles.snippet: In a rare act of defiance, people across the country who bought property from indebted developers are refusing to repay loans on their unfinished apartments.
articles.abstract: In a rare act of defiance, people across the country who bought property from indebted developers are refusing to repay loans on their unfinished apartments.
articles.lead_paragraph: For decades, buying property was considered a safe investment in China. Now, instead of building a foundation of wealth for the country’s middle class, real estate has become a source of discontent and anger.

articles.headline: What Liz Cheney’s Lopsided Loss Says About the State of the G.O.P.
articles.snippet: She hoped Jan. 6 would be a turning point for Republicans. And while it did prove to be a dividing line, it was those who crossed Donald J. Trump who have faced electoral consequences.
articles.abstract: She hoped Jan. 6 would be a turning point for Republicans. And while it did prove to be a dividing line, it was those who crossed Donald J. Trump who have faced electoral consequences.
articles.lead_paragraph: Representative Liz Cheney’s martyr-like quest to stop Donald J. Trump has ensured her place in Republican Party history. But her lopsided defeat in Wyoming on Tuesday also exposed the remarkable degree to which the former president still controls the party’s present — and its near future.

articles.headline: Walensky, Citing Botched Pandemic Response, Calls for C.D.C. Reorganization
articles.snippet: Among other flaws, public guidance during the coronavirus pandemic was “confusing and overwhelming,” the agency said.
articles.abstract: Among other flaws, public guidance during the coronavirus pandemic was “confusing and overwhelming,” the agency said.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Dr. Rochelle P. Walensky, the director of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, on Wednesday delivered a sweeping rebuke of her agency’s handling of the coronavirus pandemic, saying it had failed to respond quickly enough and needed to be overhauled.
articles.byline: By Sharon LaFraniere and Noah Weiland
